node.title: Tasmania's reopening was dependent on its COVID-19 vaccination rate. Here's where it's at
node.description: Tasmania vowed to keep its border closed until it was confident every eligible resident had been offered the chance to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Now it's open again, how does its vaccination efforts compare to the rest of the country?
node.content:
["As Tasmania prepared to reopen its border\u00a0to the rest of the country \u2014 and the world \u2014 the state was in a race to vaccinate its population to defend itself from the inevitable arrival of COVID-19 on its shores.\u00a0", "Although key vaccination milestones were missed, the state government declared that there was no turning back from December 15, a date that was set in the hope that every eligible Tasmanian would have received both doses of the COVID-19 vaccine by then.", "Premier Peter Gutwein has said the state is ready and prepared to reopen and is confident every eligible Tasmanian has\u00a0been offered a COVID-19 vaccine.", "Now that borders are open\u00a0and Tasmania is welcoming\u00a0travellers back into the state, where is the state's vaccination rollout at?", "", "
Tasmania had wanted to reach a 90 per cent vaccination rate before reopening.(ABC News: Maren Preuss)
", "
Most Tasmanians have received both doses of a COVID-19 vaccine
", "Tasmania hit the all-important 90 per cent fully vaccinated milestone for those aged 16 years and over on December 11, one month after it tipped over the 80 per cent threshold.", "The state's major population centres have been sitting above the 90 per cent\u00a0rate for some time,\u00a0while those in more regional and remote local government areas (LGAs) have been playing catch up \u2014 and there were concerns this\u00a0would leave those populations vulnerable when the border\u00a0reopened.", "But with tourists now arriving, how is the state tracking?", "The good news is every one of Tasmania's LGAs, excluding Kentish, has surpassed the 80 per cent vaccination rate for second doses, and nine are above the 90 per cent threshold, which will help the state stand in good stead when\u00a0COVID-19 inevitably arrives.", "There are some caveats with this data, however. Flinders Island, King Island, Glamorgan Spring Bay and the West Coast are unable to be included, due to their population sizes, but they have been counted in the state's broader tally.", "The figures are also only current until 11:59pm AEDT on December 12, so any vaccinations that have been given in the state between then and now haven't been included.", "And, lastly, the LGA data counts those aged 15 years and over who are fully vaccinated \u2014 even though people aged 12 and above are eligible to receive a COVID-19 vaccine, and children between 5 and 11 are able to make an appointment to receive their first dose in January.", "
How does Tasmania compare to the rest of the country?
", "Prior to Tasmania opening up to tourists, Premier Peter Gutwein said the state was primed to be \"one of the most vaccinated places on the planet\" and had one of the highest rates of vaccination in the country for those aged 16 years and over.", "It turns out Tasmania is only marginally behind the ACT when it comes to vaccination rates for those aged over 16 years.", "In Tasmania, 90.2 per cent of people aged 16 years and above are fully vaccinated against COVID-19.\u00a0", "
What about 12 to 15 year olds?
", "Mr Gutwein is also expecting Tasmania to reach the 90 per cent fully vaccinated threshold for those aged 12 years and over by December 17.", "Although the night before borders reopened, the state was sitting at an 88.8 per cent vaccination rate for the over-12 years age group, there is still some ground to cover before those in the 12 to 15 years age range reach the 80 and 90 per cent milestones.", "Despite these rates appearing lower than what was shown in previous charts, it's worth keeping in mind that people aged 12 to 15 years were among the last to be eligible to receive a COVID-19 vaccine, but\u00a0there has been a strong uptake since they were eligible.\u00a0", "
How does Tasmania compare to the rest of the world?
", "Since the Premier says Tasmania is \"one of the safest places on the planet\", let's look at a hyopthetical comparison if the state were ever to secede from the mainland.", "One thing to keep in mind here is that we are looking at the total population and not those aged 12 years and over, or 16 years and over, so Tasmania's fully vaccinated figure looks a little lower than what we're used to seeing and this data is from December 12.\u00a0", "That said, compared to a small selection of international countries, Tasmania is up there in terms of the rate of people who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19.", "That feat is all the more impressive considering the state only hit the 50 per cent milestone for those aged 16 years and over back in September, a time when open borders and the freedom to travel around Australia seemed a world away from today's reality.", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
